review:
Better than iPhone X  
Better performance

Two weeks over. So far so good and overall phone is good and value for money.  
  
Just disable lot of software which comes pre-installed with S8. Battery is
lasting more than 15 plus hours with charge once a day and which looks good
and hope it will continue to perform like that over a course of time in
future. Keep you all posted.  
  
I have a put a case to protect the phone as it is delicate in case it falls
down. Not sure what to put to protect the screen, if anyone has good
suggestion then please share.

To be truthful, based on professional reviews, I discarded this tall, narrow
phone with an awkwardly placed fingerprint scanner and a smaller battery than
S7 edge, a phone I found inconvenient and sold off in a month. So, it was
iPhone 8, but all the hype evaporated when it was unveiled. So it was back to
scouting around. I shortlisted OP5, Nokia 8 and S8. As S8 had been in the
market for 2 months I went to a nearby store, handled it and asked for
feedback. I was cautious - S8, S8+ and Note 8 looked too good to be true.
Reluctantly I ruled out the larger ones, as the are not handy for those
without jackets most times.  
  
Still, it was the last day of an offer, better than Amazon, so I bought S8 for
49.9k with 12 interest free EMIs and a screen replacement. My preferred color
gold wasnt available, but I liked the black too, so went ahead.  
  
Other reviews have already covered the tech elements, so let me share my user
experience of 1 month, that made me fall in love with this phone - easily the
best phone I've owned after iPhone4.  
  
I use my phone primarily for communication (calls, SMS, WA, SM and utility
apps}, though I do entertain myself on trips, waiting time with videos, high
end games etc. I havent and dont think I'll enjoy a 2 hr movie on phone. (Must
admit I'm watching longer videos more frequently on s8 though)  
  
This phone worked beautifully out of the box - calls, music, videos, GPS
positioning, mobile network - everything is fast and flawless. No need to
fiddle with settings, no lagging, heating, hunting for charger all day. I've
started using My galaxy assistant and now Bixby, and I like the look, feel and
non intrusive convenience. BTW, I love that its actually easier to hold than
5.5 in phones, fast charging, battery life, the photo quality and the
headphones. On top of that, both colors of the phone look classy. So, I guess
I'm really saying whats not to like?  
  
I hate changing phones and shifting data, which Samsung Switch made short work
of.  
  
If S8 has any drawback, its the super intrusive google, but thats ubiquitous
:-(. If only this phone was on IOS, it would be perfection.  
  
Some nitpicks that you should know :-  
(1) hard to find quality tempered glass and cover, which is a must as this
phone is glass on both sides. The samsung original one is gimmicky and the one
salesman was using looked scruffy, so I didnt pay 3000 for it, but bought a
expensive 3rd party flip cover (picture enclosed) Not ideal but it doesnt look
hideous.  
(2) It comes with a small USB-C to micro-USB adapter, but I just bought an
extra cable for office, and its all good. Thankfully, Samsung retained the 3.5
mm headphone jack.  
(3) Only a hybrid slot. But thats all new phones and iphone doesnt even have
either, so this is much better.  
  
If Samsung folks are listening, please - SIM cards and memory cards are NOT
interchangeable, they do different things, so please be a trendbreaker and
bring back a separate memory card on S8S oops S9.  
  
Hope this helped you decide. Good luck with your decision.

The design is pretty good and stylish.

review:
its an evolution. the design is trend setting, rival companies trying hard to
get the curvy 18:9 right. Yes the battery is not for heavy user but its better
than note 8 though. True bezelless with heavy touchwiz features. Careful with
the drops though, it got glass on its back.

Using this beautiful device for the past 2 weeks amid am writing this review
from the phone only. It's a splendid machine. Screen, speed overall feel is
premium and fantastic. Was using HTC M8 eye for the past 2.5 years and this
beat is a perfect replacement.  
Pros:  
Great looking  
Screen is one of the bests, if not the best  
Performance is top quality, no lags at all  
Battery back up is quite good. With 2 sims and always 4g mode, normal gaming
and an hour of calls, battery lasts for more than a day  
UI is quite simple  
  
Cons:  
Speaker quality is no match to HTC s  
Getting quality screen guard is very difficult  
Expensive  
Samsung galaxy s normally slows down over time, let's wait and watch for this
beauty

Not sure if it justifies the price tag, but ignore that bit and the phone
satisfies you immensely. Holding and using it in one hand is very comfortable.
Display, battery backup and other basics are all up to what you expect from
the flagship S series. Knowing that it is the gadget of choice for most tech
YouTubers and bloggers also helps. The Orchid grey colour I own is the best
followed by black and then blue. Not using any cover or screen guard but
thinking of ordering a two piece cover given its fragility. The Gorilla glass
isn't invincible since I have caught minor scratches already and my friend
even broke it on the edge by dropping it once. Free screen replacements should
come handy, though I'm wary of replaced screens after a pathetic experience
with Mi. Note 8 is way too large and expensive for me to be comfortable with.
Iphone X would've been a good choice had it been launched when I bought this.  
Of all the things, the only gripe is the very average 4gb ram. Regardless of
whether it'll come in use or not, its premium price tag begs at least 6gb of
ram to keep up a fair game. In fact, I had my Gallery force close quite some
time and apps getting stuck in between too. All that could've been saved by
upgrading the ram.

Hello, friends if you want to buy good built quality and sexy phone then
Samsung Galaxy S8 perfect for you. If you want to know the sound quality of
this phone so for me, it is very good, Because It provides very sharp and
high-quality audio. I bought this phone with 4 GB RAM and 64 GB internal
memory. You can store the large amount of data like movies, videos and also
audios without inserting any SD card but can insert up to 256 GB SD card. S8
has Quad HD+ Display made with SUPER AMOLED glass which I love and It
protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 5. Its display size is 5.8 inch. It also
has Exynos 8895 Octa Chipset and 12 MP primary camera and 8 MP front camera.
This phone comes with Android 7.0 Nougat software version. Because It's huge
and giant display I like to see high-quality movies and it's feeling amazing.
If I talk about the camera so the camera is very good both rear and front.
This phone comes with 3500 MAH Li-ion battery so you can say for this giant
display this battery is not good. But after my usage battery performance is so
much good. The lightweight and beautifully slim design make this phone very
unique and stylish compared to other phones available on the market. But I
don't like one thing of this phone that it's fingerprint sensor placement. But
sensor quality is good and It has Iris Scanner which I don't use in my regular
usage. If I talk about service and support so I didn't face any problem with
this phone. And the last thing I should say for me It is value for money
product.  
I bought this phone and using for one month then only am giving my review.  
Thankyou

Ultimate phone.. got at rs 45900

I am using galaxy s8 from 15th May 2017.. Some pros and cons...  
Pros  
1\. Big screen in such a compact size... Only Samsung can do this.. Just hold
s8 in ur hand than u will realise how compact it is..  
2\. Best qhd Amoled screen  
3\. Fingerprint reader is very quick and I love the placement of
fingerprint.... Its easy to use in s8 but difficult in s8+  
4\. Iris scanner... Its best security feature of s8  
5\. Camera.... Samsung is king in camera department of smartphones...Best
result in daylight and night... In night no smartphone camera comes near to s8  
6\. Speaker are loud and clear  
7\. UI is mostly stock with samsung flavour... Its buttery smooth..  
8\. Battery life is good. It gives me around 5 hr screen on time with Always
on display..  
9\. Charging time... It took 90hr to fully charge the mobile... Its not
fastest but fast enough  
  
There are two cons...  
1\. Iris scanner not work in sunlight... It works perfectly in indoor and dark
situation but in outdoor with bright light it fails..  
2\. Wireless Charging... Its very slow... It takes 2hr40min to completely
charge the mobile.  
  
So guys s8 is king of 2017...Just go for it☺️👌👍
